[I]0-i woke with [my]0-i heart pounding , the sheets drenched in sweat CREOLE SHRIMP AND GRITS Makes 4 servings 4 cups water 1 cup stone - ground grits 3 tablespoons butter 2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese 1 pound raw shrimp , peeled and deveined 6 slices bacon , chopped 4 teaspoons lemon juice 2 tablespoons fresh parsley , chopped 1 cup scallions , sliced 1 clove garlic , minced kosher salt freshly ground pepper Preparation In stockpot , bring water to a boil . Reduce heat to simmer , add grits , salt , and pepper , and cook until water is absorbed , about 20 minutes . Remove from heat and stir in butter and cheese . Fry the bacon in a large skillet until browned . Remove to paper towels , drain well , and chop . Rinse shrimp and pat dry . Add into bacon grease and cook until shrimp turn pink . Do not overcook . Add lemon juice , chopped bacon , parsley , scallions , and garlic , and sauté for 3 minutes . Spoon cooked grits into serving bowls . Add shrimp mixture on top . Serve immediately . Deep fry in batches , flipping constantly , until golden . Geissinger]85-the author j.t. geissinger]401-my developmental editor who i would literally die without , who flagged t about the author j.t. geissinger is the author of more than a dozen novels of contemporary romance , paranormal romance , and romantic suspense . [She]85-the author j.t. geissinger is the recipient of the Prism Award for Best First Book and the Golden Quill Award for Best Paranormal / Urban Fantasy . [She]85-the author j.t. geissinger ’s a two - time finalist for the RITA Award from [the Romance Writers of [America]15-america]402-the romance writers of america , and [her]85-the author j.t. geissinger works have been finalists in the Booksellers ’ Best , National Readers ’ Choice , and Daphne du Maurier Awards . CREOLE SHRIMP AND GRITS Makes 4 servings

4 cups water 1 cup stone - ground grits 3 tablespoons butter 2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese 1 pound raw shrimp , peeled and deveined 6 slices bacon , chopped 4 teaspoons lemon juice 2 tablespoons fresh parsley , chopped 1 cup scallions , sliced 1 clove garlic , minced kosher salt freshly ground pepper

Preparation

In stockpot , bring water to a boil . Reduce heat to simmer , add grits , salt , and pepper , and cook until water is absorbed , about 20 minutes . Remove from heat and stir in butter and cheese . Fry the bacon in a large skillet until browned . Remove to paper towels , drain well , and chop . Rinse shrimp and pat dry . Add into bacon grease and cook until shrimp turn pink . Do not overcook . Add lemon juice , chopped bacon , parsley , scallions , and garlic , and saut√ © for 3 minutes . Spoon cooked grits into serving bowls . Add shrimp mixture on top . Serve immediately .

[BIANCA]60-bianca ’S OLD CUBAN Makes 1 serving

2 ounces prosecco 1½ ounces bourbon 1 ounce simple syrup ¾ ounce fresh lime juice 2 dashes Angostura bitters fresh mint leaves to garnish

Preparation

Combine all ingredients except prosecco in a shaker and fill with ice . Shake vigorously to chill . Strain into a chilled coupe glass . Top with prosecco and garnish with mint .

Simple Syrup Preparation Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in saucepan and bring to a boil , stirring until sugar is dissolved . Remove from heat . Store leftovers in airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks .

Inconveniently , the ground did n’t open up and swallow [me]0-i whole .

GINGER - ORANGE CHEESECAKE Makes 8 servings

1½ cups graham cracker crumbs ⅓ cup butter , melted ⅓ cup white sugar 32 ounces cream cheese , softened ⅔ cup white sugar , plus 2 tablespoons 1 cup sour cream , divided 1 tablespoon grated orange peel 4 eggs 2 cups clementine wedges ½ cup finely chopped crystallized ginger

Preparation

Preheat oven to 325 degrees . Mix graham cracker crumbs , butter , and ⅓ cup sugar together . Press on bottom of 9² x 3² springform pan and just enough up sides to seal bottom . Place cream cheese , ⅔ cup sugar , ½ cup sour cream , and orange peel in food processor . Cover and process about 3 minutes or until smooth . Add eggs . Cover and process until well blended . Spread over crust . Bake 1 hour 20 minutes , or until center is set . Cool on wire rack for 15 minutes . Using spatula around edges to loosen , remove side of pan . Refrigerate uncovered 3 hours or until chilled , then cover and continue refrigerating at least 4 hours , but not longer than 48 hours . Mix ½ cup sour cream and 2 tablespoons sugar and spread over top of cheesecake . Top with fresh fruit and crystallized ginger . Store uneaten portion covered with foil in fridge .

TWELVE BIANCA Though [I]0-i wanted to turn and bolt , [I]0-i did n’t . [The man]2303-the man had paid [me]0-i an obscene amount of money for this job , after all . And [I]0-i was [a professional]2304-a professional . [I]0-i would n’t embarrass [him]2303-the man in front of all [[his]2303-the man guests]2305-his guests by refusing [his]2303-the man request . Also , [I]0-i was intrigued by this new [Jackson]147-jackson , [this well - dressed stranger who spoke so eloquently about honor and selflessness and used words like please]2306-this well - dressed stranger who spoke so eloquently about honor and selflessness and used words like please . [I]0-i did n’t think that word was in [his]147-jackson vocabulary . So it was with curiosity — and a healthy dose of embarrassment — that [I]0-i walked around the perimeter of the tables and climbed the few stairs to [the stage]2307-the stage . Then shock took over as [Jackson]147-jackson wound [his]147-jackson arm around [my]0-i shoulders , pulled [me]0-i against [his]147-jackson side , and smiled down at [me]0-i . How hard [he]147-jackson was , all over . [I]0-i ’m definitely hallucinating . Or [Jackson Boudreaux]54-jackson has [a twin [no one]274-no one knows about]1042-a twin no one knows about . At that moment , [he]1050-he tilted [his]1050-he head and sent [me]0-i a sly wink . [He]1050-he winked . From [my]0-i peripheral vision , [I]0-i saw several camera flashes . Only [I]0-i could . And it was fire .

By midnight , the auction was over , [the guests]2715-the guests had left , and [a team from [the rental company]1076-the rental company]1075-a team from the rental company had arrived to strike the tent and tables . [He]1084-he said , “ Since [you]0-i like [Boudreaux]54-jackson Bourbon so much , [I]1084-he thought [you]0-i might want to try something special . ”[1084-he] [He]1084-he lifted the bottle , a beautiful piece of cut crystal filled with an amber liquid so dark it was nearly brown . [He]1084-he ’d removed [his]1084-he jacket and rolled up the sleeves of [his]1084-he white dress shirt . [I]0-i still could n’t get over how different [he]1084-he looked , though [his]1084-he hair was trying its hardest to return to its former state of disarray . Several unruly dark locks flopped over [his]1084-he forehead in an appealing , boyish way . Then [I]0-i had [myself]0-i a good , long cry .

[BIANCA]60-bianca ’S BLACKBERRY & BOURBON COBBLER Makes 8–10 servings

12 cups fresh blackberries ¾ cup raw sugar ¼ cup high - quality bourbon cooking spray ½ vanilla bean 1 cup granulated sugar 2 cups all - purpose flour 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons baking powder ½ teaspoon table salt 1 teaspoon lemon zest 1½ cups milk 1 egg ¾ teaspoon vanilla extract 6 tablespoons butter , melted

Preparation

Preheat oven to 350 degrees . Combine blackberries , raw sugar , and bourbon in a large bowl . Transfer mixture to a 13² x 9² baking dish lightly greased with cooking spray . Split vanilla bean , and scrape seeds into granulated sugar , making sure vanilla bean seeds are distributed evenly . Sift together flour , baking powder , salt , and granulated sugar mixture into a large bowl . Stir in lemon zest . Whisk together milk , egg , and vanilla extract , and then stir into dry ingredients . Add melted butter and stir . Pour batter evenly over fruit . Place dish on a baking sheet . Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown .

FIFTEEN JACKSON [I]0-i was barely listening to [[my]0-i father]2285-my father prattling into [my]0-i ear as [I]0-i stared out the window of [the library]291-the library into the sunny spring morning outside . [My]0-i attention was preoccupied with thoughts of [Bianca Hardwick]60-bianca . [FRENCH QUARTER BEIGNETS]31-french quarter beignets Makes about 3 dozen

1½ cups warm water ½ cup white sugar 1 envelope active dry yeast 2 eggs 1¼ teaspoon salt 1 cup evaporated milk 7 cups all - purpose flour ¼ cup shortening 1 quart vegetable oil 3 cups [confectioners]1340-confectioners ’ sugar

Preparation

Mix water , sugar , and yeast in large bowl and let sit for 10 minutes . In another bowl , beat the eggs , salt , and evaporated milk together . Stir egg mixture into yeast mixture . Add 3 cups of the flour to the egg / yeast mixture . Stir to combine . Add the shortening and mix . Continue to stir while slowly adding the remaining flour until all ingredients are well combined . Place dough on lightly floured surface and knead until smooth . Cover dough with plastic wrap or towel . Let rise at room temperature for 2–3 hours . Preheat oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees . Roll the dough out to ¼² thickness and cut into 2² squares . Deep fry in batches , flipping constantly , until golden . ( If beignets do n’t pop up , oil is n’t hot enough . ) Drain on paper towels . Shake confectioners ’ sugar onto hot beignets . Serve warm .

NINETEEN BIANCA [I]0-i left the same way [I]0-i arrived : in [a cab]331-a cab , by [myself]0-i , fraught with anxiety . If [[my]0-i mother]263-my mother knew what [I]0-i ’d just agreed to , [she]263-my mother ’d slap [me]0-i silly . [She]263-my mother knew [I]0-i ’d gotten the twenty thousand from [Jackson]54-jackson for the catering event , but admitting [I]0-i ’d be getting a million for marrying [myself]0-i off to [him]1343-him so [I]0-i could try to save [her]263-my mother life was another situation altogether . [DAVINA]75-davina ’S FAMOUS CREOLE [JAMBALAYA]33-jambalaya Makes 8 servings

½ pound raw bacon , diced ½ pound fresh pork sausage , casings removed ½ pound andouille sausage , sliced 3 tablespoons butter 4 boneless chicken breasts , cut into 1 - inch cubes 1 large yellow onion , diced 1 green bell pepper , diced 3 celery ribs , diced 3 garlic cloves , minced 2 cups long - grain white rice 1 teaspoon dried thyme 2 bay leaves ½ tablespoon chili powder 1½ tablespoons paprika 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper 1 teaspoon celery salt 1 can diced tomatoes 2 cups homemade ( or organic ) chicken stock 1 cup good - quality red wine 1½ pounds wild - caught raw shrimp , peeled and deveined 8 scallions , chopped fresh parsley

Preparation

In a large Dutch oven or high - sided pot , melt butter . Cook bacon and sausages for three to five minutes or until lightly browned , stirring frequently . Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper , add to pot , and cook additional 5 minutes or until browned . Add onion , bell pepper , celery , and garlic and cook until soft and fragrant , about 10 minutes . If pot seems dry , drizzle lightly with olive oil . Add rice , thyme , bay leaves , paprika , cayenne pepper , and celery salt and stir to mix . Increase heat to high . Add tomatoes , red wine , and chicken stock . Bring to a boil , reduce heat to medium / low , cover pot , and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender . When rice is done , add shrimp and green onions . Cook on low for additional 10 minutes or until shrimp is pink and cooked through . Remove bay leaves , fluff jambalaya , and serve , garnishing with fresh parsley .

TWENTY - TWO [BIANCA]53-jackson After [I]0-i hung up with [Jackson]53-jackson , it took a solid fifteen minutes of dithering before [I]0-i worked up the nerve to call [[my]0-i mother]263-my mother . [She]263-my mother answered on the first ring . “ Hi , [Mama]64-mama . How are [you]0-i ? ”[263-my mother] The gentle laugh that came over the line was reassuring . “ [I]263-my mother told [you]0-i this morning [I]263-my mother ’m feeling good today , chère . [You]0-i worry about [me]263-my mother too much . ”[263-my mother] “ That ’s good . ”[263-my mother] After listening to the cavernous silence that followed , [her]263-my mother mother - bear instincts kicked in . [She]263-my mother said sharply , “ [Bianca]53-jackson ? What ’s the matter ? ”[263-my mother] [I]0-i stared at the kitten poster on the wall of [[my]0-i office]343-my office until it blurred . “ Uh . . . ”[263-my mother] Be brave . [You]263-my mother ’ve got this . [Terrified]76-terrified , [I]0-i cleared [my]0-i throat . “ There ’s someone [I]0-i ’d like [you]263-my mother to meet . ”[0-i] [She]263-my mother did n’t even miss a beat . “ Who , [Jackson Boudreaux]53-jackson ? ”[263-my mother] [My]0-i jaw hit the desk . [I]0-i should ’ve known [she]263-my mother ’d blab ! The air leaked from [my]0-i lungs like a punctured balloon . [Mama]64-mama said , “ Well , [he]1467-he might have a reputation for being too big for [his]1467-he britches , but [the man]2303-the man must have some sense in [his]1467-he head to fall in love with [you]0-i . ”[64-mama] Love ? [Her]64-mama tone became businesslike . “ Bring [him]1467-he by tomorrow at ten o’clock . And be prepared to leave for a few minutes so [I]64-mama can give [him]1467-he the business . [He]1467-he does n’t get to marry into [this family]2842-this family unless [he]1467-he ’s good enough for [you]0-i . ”[64-mama] [She]64-mama hung up , leaving [me]0-i staring in bewilderment at the phone . The dreamlike feeling intensified . [Body snatchers]1468-body snatchers , [I]0-i thought . That was the only rational explanation for [her]64-mama nonchalance . [Aliens]181-aliens had stolen [[my]0-i mother]263-my mother and replaced [her]263-my mother with a robot look - alike . Right now [the robot]1470-the robot was sitting blank eyed in [Mama]64-mama ’s armchair downloading instructions from the mother ship . Or maybe the chemo had unraveled something inside [her]64-mama brain . Or [I]0-i ’d been involved in a serious car accident and was lying in a hospital bed somewhere , doped up to the gills , [my]0-i opiate - soaked brain manufacturing this whole thing . “ Only one way to find out , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said aloud to [the empty room]1471-the empty room and then cackled like [a lunatic]308-a lunatic . [I]0-i was taking [the Beast]65-the beast [home]2310-home to meet [[my]0-i mother]263-my mother . [The world]371-the world had officially come to an end .

At five minutes to ten o’clock the next morning , [I]0-i sat on the edge of the sofa in [[Mama]64-mama ’s living room]1476-mama ’s living room , pretending [I]0-i was n’t having a brain embolism while [I]0-i waited for [Jackson Boudreaux]53-jackson to knock on the front door . TWENTY - FOUR BIANCA [I]0-i chose [a corner bedroom]2326-a corner bedroom that had windows on two walls and a built - in bookcase on a third that reached all the way to the vaulted ceiling . CREOLE OKRA GUMBO Makes 6 servings

4 tablespoons butter kosher salt 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper 1½ pounds boneless chicken thighs , skin removed , cut into pieces 4 ounces tasso ham , cut into 1² cubes 3 cloves garlic , minced 2 teaspoons thyme , minced 1 bay leaf 1 yellow onion , minced 1 red bell pepper , minced 1 tablespoon fresh parsley , minced 6 large fresh tomatoes , skin , core , and seeds removed 2 tablespoons tomato paste 6 cups chicken stock 1 pound okra , trimmed , sliced ½ inch thick 6 cups cooked white rice

Preparation

Melt butter in Dutch oven . Season chicken with salt and cayenne on both sides , cook for 10 minutes or until browned . Add tasso and garlic , cook for 5 minutes . Add thyme , bay leaf , onion , and bell pepper . Cook until browned , 5–10 minutes . Add parsley , tomatoes , and tomato paste . Cook 5 minutes or until softened . Add chicken stock , bring to a boil . Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken is cooked through and gumbo has thickened , about 1 hour . Melt remaining butter in a nonstick skillet . Cook okra until slightly crisp , 8–10 minutes , then add to gumbo . Cook gumbo additional 15 minutes . Discard bay leaf . Serve over hot white rice .

THIRTY - ONE [JACKSON]53-jackson [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was dreaming because the warm , soft , unmistakable curve under [my]0-i left palm was [a woman]256-a woman ’s hip . BLOODY DIXIE Makes 4 servings

1 32 - ounce bottle of tomato juice 2 ounces vodka 1 tablespoon freshly grated horseradish ( or prepared ) 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 tablespoon hot sauce 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce dash of celery salt dash of pepper 4 slices cooked bacon 4 ribs celery

Preparation

Pour out Â¼ cup tomato juice from bottle . Mix horseradish , lemon juice , hot sauce , Worcestershire , celery salt , and pepper into the remaining tomato juice in bottle and shake vigorously . Add ice to 4 highball glasses . Pour 2 ounces vodka over ice in each glass ( or to [your]2033-your taste ) . Add tomato juice mix to fill . Stir , then garnish with bacon and celery .

That day passed . Heartless how the sun has the nerve to rise and set and rise again , witness to so much ruin .

SLAP , SLAP , KISS COCKTAIL Makes 2 servings

1 ounce cognac 3 ounces vodka 2 ounces absinthe 1Â½ ounces gin 1 ounce blackberry liqueur

Preparation

Put all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice . Shake vigorously . Strain into two chilled cocktail glasses . Down the hatch , kiss [[your]2252-you beloved]391-your beloved , enjoy a very potent happily ever after .

ACKNOWLEDGMENTS This is the fourteenth novel [I]0-i ’ve published in five years . ABOUT [THE AUTHOR

J.T. Geissinger]85-the author j.t. geissinger is the author of more than a dozen novels of contemporary romance , paranormal romance , and romantic suspense . [She]85-the author j.t. geissinger is the recipient of the Prism Award for Best First Book and the Golden Quill Award for Best Paranormal / Urban Fantasy . [She]85-the author j.t. geissinger ’s a two - time finalist for the RITA Award from [the Romance Writers of [America]15-america]402-the romance writers of america , and [her]85-the author j.t. geissinger works have been finalists in [the Booksellers]2273-the booksellers ’ Best , National Readers ’ Choice , and Daphne du Maurier Awards . Join [[her]85-the author j.t. geissinger Facebook reader ’s group — [Geissinger]85-the author j.t. geissinger ’s Gang]2274-her facebook reader ’s group — geissinger ’s gang — to take part in weekly live chats and giveaways , find out more information about works in progress , get access to exclusive excerpts and contests , and receive advance reader copies of [her]85-the author j.t. geissinger upcoming releases . [You]2275-you can also check out [her]85-the author j.t. geissinger website , www.jtgeissinger.com , or follow [her]85-the author j.t. geissinger on Instagram @JTGeissingerauthor and on Twitter @JTGeissinger .
